meaningMnemonic:
On the bottom of <radical>bamboo</radical> <radical>root</radical>s, there’s a <radical>stamp</radical> that tells you the <kanji>season</kanji> in which it was cut.

Additionally, the stamp also has information on the condition of the bamboo’s <kanji>joint</kanji>s, because no one wants to buy bamboo with damaged joints!
readingMnemonic: These <kanji>season</kanji> stamps are marked on bamboo <reading>sets</reading> (せつ). You can't buy a single banana or a single grape, and just like that, if you want some nice seasonal bamboo, you have to buy them in sets.
